page.content:
BEDFORDSHIRE AGAINST NUCLEAR DUMPING
BAND is a non-politcal organisation working locally to stop NIREX dumping radioactive waste at Elstow Depot. They do not agree with the proposal for shallow burial but suggest that waste should be stored on the sites of nuclear power stations. This is where waste is stored at present and can be constantly monitored for leakage. BAND believe that since October 1983 the Government has been "hell bent on coming to Elstow". In the document they supplied to us they state that it is not the Oxford clay that attracted NIREX as it is more irregular here than elsewhere, but the fact that the land is owned by the Central Electricity Generating Board; a parent organisation of NIREX.
